intro: Anagallis arvensis f. lilacina, commonly known as the lilac-flowered mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of delicate, lilac-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils in temperate regions. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This subspecies is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in other open habitats.
